parts.content:
Proof



> Let $a = 0$ and arbitrary $b \in \mathbb{N}$.


> $0 \in \mathbb{N}$, so $a \in \mathbb{N}$.


> By definition of natural numbers, $0$ is the smallest natural number. Thus, the statement $0 \leq b$ holds true, since arbitrary $b$ can only be $\geq 0$.


> Thus, $a \leq b$ when $a = 0$, satisfying the condition $\square$.
